intro: Cola ruawaensis, commonly known as the Ruawa cola, is a species of plant native to parts of West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. After flowering, it develops round, hard fruits that contain several seeds. This species is valued for its potential use in traditional medicine and as a source of natural compounds.
